description: Immutability means once a value is created, it cannot be modified. Instead of changing data in place, new values are returned.

examples.basic:
x = 10
# integers are immutable
y = x
x = x + 5  # creates new integer
examples.advanced:
# region tuples are immutable
t = (1, 2, 3)
# t[0] = 99  # error
# endregion
examples.realworld:
# strings are immutable
path = "/api"
full = path + "/v1"  # new string

examples.basic:
const x = 10; // cannot be reassigned
// but objects inside const can be mutated
examples.realworld:
const config = { retries: 3 };
const newConfig = { ...config, retries: 5 };

examples.basic:
// basic types are immutable-like
x := 10
y := x
x = 20 // y remains unchanged
const int x = 10; // cannot modify x
examples.realworld:
const std::string base = "/app";
auto path = base + "/config"; // new string
